SEARCH
Package javazoom.jl.decoder

Class Bitstream

java.lang.Object
javazoom.jl.decoder.Bitstream
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable, BitstreamErrors, JavaLayerErrors
public final class Bitstream extends Object implements BitstreamErrors, AutoCloseable
The Bitstream class is responsible for parsing an MPEG audio bitstream.

Optimized version with additional helper APIs and improved performance.

Since:
1.0.2
Author:
MDM (original), Optimized version

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from interface javazoom.jl.decoder.BitstreamErrors

    BITSTREAM_LAST, INVALIDFRAME, STREAM_EOF, STREAM_ERROR, UNEXPECTED_EOF, UNKNOWN_ERROR, UNKNOWN_SAMPLE_RATE

    Fields inherited from interface javazoom.jl.decoder.JavaLayerErrors

    BITSTREAM_ERROR, DECODER_ERROR

    • Bitstream

      public Bitstream(InputStream in)
      Construct a Bitstream that reads data from a given InputStream.
      Parameters:
      in - The InputStream to read from (must not be null)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if in is null

  • Method Details

    • getHeaderPosition

      public int getHeaderPosition()
      Return position of the first audio header.
      Returns:
      size of ID3v2 tag frames

    • header_pos

      @Deprecated public int header_pos()
      Deprecated.
      Use getHeaderPosition() instead

    • getRawID3v2

      public InputStream getRawID3v2()
      Return raw ID3v2 frames + header.
      Returns:
      ID3v2 InputStream or null if ID3v2 frames are not available

    • hasID3v2Tag

      public boolean hasID3v2Tag()
      Check if ID3v2 tag is present.
      Returns:
      true if ID3v2 tag exists
      Since:
      1.0.2

    • getID3v2TagSize

      public int getID3v2TagSize()
      Get the size of the ID3v2 tag in bytes.
      Returns:
      ID3v2 tag size, or 0 if no tag present
      Since:
      1.0.2

    • readFrame

      public Header readFrame() throws BitstreamException
      Reads and parses the next frame from the input source.
      Returns:
      the Header describing details of the frame read, or null if the end of the stream has been reached
      Throws:
      BitstreamException - if an error occurs

    • closeFrame

      public void closeFrame()
      Close the current frame.

    • readBits

      public int readBits(int n)
      Read bits - wrapper for Header compatibility.
      Parameters:
      n - number of bits to read
      Returns:
      bits value

    • readCheckedBits

      public int readCheckedBits(int n)
      Read checked bits - wrapper for Header compatibility. TODO: implement CRC check
      Parameters:
      n - number of bits to read
      Returns:
      bits value

    • isSyncMark

      public boolean isSyncMark(int headerstring, int syncmode, int word)
      Check if header string is a valid sync mark.
      Parameters:
      headerstring - the header bits
      syncmode - INITIAL_SYNC or STRICT_SYNC
      word - sync word to match
      Returns:
      true if valid sync mark

    • getBits

      public int getBits(int numberOfBits)
      Read bits from buffer into the lower bits of an unsigned int. The LSB contains the latest read bit of the stream.

      Optimized version with better bounds checking.

      Parameters:
      numberOfBits - number of bits to read (0-32)
      Returns:
      the bits as an unsigned int

    • isSyncCurrentPosition

      public boolean isSyncCurrentPosition(int syncmode) throws BitstreamException
      Determines if the next 4 bytes of the stream represent a frame header.
      Parameters:
      syncmode - INITIAL_SYNC or STRICT_SYNC
      Returns:
      true if sync mark found at current position
      Throws:
      BitstreamException - on error

    • unreadFrame

      public void unreadFrame() throws BitstreamException
      Unreads the bytes read from the frame. Used when a frame needs to be re-read.
      Throws:
      BitstreamException - on error

    • getBit

      public int getBit()
      Read a single bit.
      Returns:
      0 or 1
      Since:
      1.0.2

      Parameters:

    • close

      public void close() throws BitstreamException
      Close the bitstream and release resources.

      This method is idempotent - calling it multiple times has no effect.

      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Throws:
      BitstreamException - if an I/O error occurs
      Since:
      1.0.2
